result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Edward Briant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

- $243.00 Court Costs, Payable through Clerk of Court
- $200.00 DNA Surcharge, Payable through Clerk of Court
payment plan approved- repayment rate of $100.00 per month commencing 11/15/22

e: DA, Atty Schmidt   c: DE and New Richmond PD.

10:33AM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K. Anderson, Attorney Erica Ellenwood in court for State of Wisconsin, Defendant Michael Edward Briant in court.  Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt in court for Michael Edward Briant. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 - Disorderly Conduct. DE sworn. Court reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Court finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Court accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 - Disorderly Conduct. Sentencing recommendations. 

Court orders: 
Ct 1 - Disorderly Conduct
7 days jail, TIME SERVED
- Court Costs $243; payable through Clerk of Court
- DNA Sample and Surcharge $200; payable through Clerk of Court

Apply bond on file, payment plan approved - repayment of $100/mo commencing 11/15/22. 
Adjourned: 10:39 AM. kma
to reschedule PLEAS scheduled for 10/17/22, filed by Atty Schmidt. bph   To ty

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Tobritzhofer residence  530 S Minnesota Ave.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

01:20 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Michael Edward Briant. Defendant Michael Edward Briant in court, in custody. DE confirms address and DOB. DE understands charges and possible penalties. Waive reading. DE does qualify for PD. Enter NG. Bond argument. Court orders bond. Court sets SETC and PSC. Adjourned
